005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.regex;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.AbstractCodedMetapathException;
009
010public class RegularExpressionMetapathException
011    extends AbstractCodedMetapathException {
012  /**
013   * the serial version UID.
014   */
015  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
016  /**
017   * <a href=
018   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORX0001">err:MPRX0001</a>:
019   * Raised by regular expression functions such as <a href=
020   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-matches">fn:matches</a> and
021   * <a href=
022   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-replace">fn:replace</a> if
023   * the regular expression flags contain a character other than i, m, q, s, or x.
024   */
025  public static final int INVALID_FLAG = 1;
026  /**
027   * <a href=
028   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORX0002">err:MPRX0002</a>:
029   * Raised by regular expression functions such as <a href=
030   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-matches">fn:matches</a> and
031   * <a href=
032   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-replace">fn:replace</a> if
033   * the regular expression is syntactically invalid.
034   */
035  public static final int INVALID_EXPRESSION = 2;
036  /**
037   * <a href=
038   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORX0003">err:MPRX0003</a>: For
039   * functions such as <a href=
040   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-replace">fn:replace</a> and
041   * <a href=
042   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-tokenize">fn:tokenize</a>,
043   * raises an error if the supplied regular expression is capable of matching a
044   * zero length string.
045   */
046  public static final int MATCHES_ZERO_LENGTH_STRING = 3;
047  /**
048   * <a href=
049   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#ERRFORX0004">err:MPRX0004</a>:
050   * Raised by <a href=
051   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-replace">fn:replace</a> to
052   * report errors in the replacement string.
053   */
054  public static final int INVALID_REPLACEMENT_STRING = 4;
055
056  /**
057   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, {@code message},
058   * and {@code cause}.
059   *
060   * @param code
061   *          the error code value
062   * @param message
063   *          the exception message
064   * @param cause
065   *          the original exception cause
066   */
067  public RegularExpressionMetapathException(int code, String message, Throwable cause) {
068    super(code, message, cause);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, {@code message},
073   * and no cause.
074   *
075   * @param code
076   *          the error code value
077   * @param message
078   *          the exception message
079   */
080  public RegularExpressionMetapathException(int code, String message) {
081    super(code, message);
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Constructs a new exception with the provided {@code code}, no message, and
086   * the {@code cause}.
087   *
088   * @param code
089   *          the error code value
090   * @param cause
091   *          the original exception cause
092   */
093  public RegularExpressionMetapathException(int code, Throwable cause) {
094    super(code, cause);
095  }
096
097  @Override
098  public String getCodePrefix() {
099    return "MPRX";
100  }
101}
